On Escalation Ticket # 00423829 the new comment has been added: Mihai Rosca:

@Jonathan Micheal Orford There is a setting in System Status->HDD Disk Space and Log Rotation. Only if this setting enabled old logs will be automatically overwritten by the new ones when the Server’s disk space reaches a certain percentage (starting from 50% up to 90%, it's customizable).

Is this setting set on on the customer's environment?

Now, going further, a system alert can be set up for admins to be notified when e chosen disk space threshold has been reached. Alerts are being sent by email, they need the e-mail settings to be configured correctly.


To my current knowledge, the feature should work. Currently checking to see if there are any outstanding unknown issues in that area that we should be aware of.

[DevOps CommentId:11065470]

On Escalation Ticket # 00423829 the new comment has been added: Mihaela Benta:

They do not have the posibility to set an alert for node disk space until 710, and they have 7061 . This is the user story https://dev.azure.com/NetwrixCorporation/CoSoSys-Unify/_workitems/edit/320478
 
@Jonathan Micheal Orford @Mihai Rosca
